org.haldean.chopper.pilot
Class ChopperStatus

java.lang.Object
  org.haldean.chopper.pilot.ChopperStatus
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.hardware.SensorEventListener, android.location.LocationListener, Constants
public final class ChopperStatus
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.hardware.SensorEventListener, Constants, android.location.LocationListener

Central "storehouse" for information about the chopper's status--maintains updated sensor readings, gps readings, etc.

May send the following messages to registered Receivables:

 CSYS:LOWPOWER
 GPS:STATUS:
            DISABLED
            ENABLED
            OUT.OF.SERVICE
            TEMPORARILY.UNAVAILABLE
            AVAILABLE

Author:
Benjamin Bardin, Will Brown

getBatteryLevel

public float getBatteryLevel()
Gets the phone battery level

Returns:

getGpsExtrasNow

public java.lang.String getGpsExtrasNow()
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Gets GPS "extras" data, through a string of the form accuracy:numberOfSatellitesInLatFix:timeStampOfLastFix

Returns:
The data string
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the lock is currently in use.

getGpsField

public double getGpsField(int whichField)
Returns the value stored at the specified GPS index. If its lock is unavailable, blocks until it is.

Parameters:
whichField - The index of the desired GPS data.
Returns:
The desired GPS data.

getGpsFieldNow

public double getGpsFieldNow(int whichField)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Returns the value stored at the specified GPS index, if its lock is available. Otherwise, throws an exception.

Parameters:
whichField - The index of the desired GPS data.
Returns:
The desired GPS data.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the lock for the desired data is unavailable.

getGpsFieldNow

public double getGpsFieldNow(int whichField,
                             double expectedValue)
Returns the value stored at the specified GPS index, if its lock is available. Otherwise, returns the supplied default value.

Parameters:
whichField - The index of the desired GPS data.
expectedValue - The default to return, should its lock be unavailable.
Returns:
Either the GPS data or the supplied default, depending on whether or not its lock is available.

getLastLocation

public android.location.Location getLastLocation()
Returns a copy of the most recent Location object delivered by the GPS.

Returns:
The Location, if there is one; null if the GPS has not yet obtained a fix.

getMotorFieldsNow

public double[] getMotorFieldsNow()
                           throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Obtains the current motor speeds.

Returns:
A copy of the array containing the motor speeds.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the lock is unavailable.

getPersistentThreadInstance

public PersistentThread getPersistentThreadInstance()
Obtains the thread that registers this ChopperStatus as a SensorListener. On first call to this method, the PersistentThread is created. But since two or more instances of ChopperStatus should not be run concurrently, subsequent calls to this method return only that first thread.

Returns:
The PersistentThread that registers as a ChopperStatus, and obtains all sensor/GPS updates.

registerReceiver

public void registerReceiver(Receivable rec)
Registers a receivable for certain status-related updates, especially a Navigation object.

Parameters:
rec - The receivable to register.
See Also:
Navigation

setMotorFields

protected void setMotorFields(double[] mySpeeds)
Spawns a thread that sets the motor speeds info to the supplied values, after cloning them for safe multi-threading. Uses a new thread to permit the caller (usually Guidance) to move on to a new task immediately.

Parameters:
mySpeeds - The data to which the motor speeds should be set.
